## 판결문 요약


677 S.E.2d 887 (2009)
Brian Scott BAKER and Janna C. Jordan-Baker, Plaintiffs,
v.
Prudence ROSNER, Ed Rosner, Jo Faulk, and Nova Realty, Inc., Defendants.
No. COA08-1298.
Court of Appeals of North Carolina.
June 16, 2009.
*888 William H. Helms, Monroe, for Plaintiffs-Appellees.
Horack, Talley, Pharr & Lowndes, P.A., by John W. Bowers, Charlotte, for Defendants-Appellants.
BEASLEY, Judge.
Defendants appeal from the trial court's order striking Defendants' answers and entering default as to the Plaintiffs' claims for fraud against each Defendant. We affirm in part, reverse in part, and remand for further proceedings.
*889 The record shows the following: in September 2006, Brian Scott Baker and Janna C. Jordan-Baker (Plaintiffs) filed a complaint against Prudence Rosner, Ed Rosner, Jo Faulk, and Nova Realty, Inc. (Defendants) in connection with Plaintiff's purchase of a home located at 4520 Ferguson Circle in Waxhaw, North Carolina. Prudence Rosner was the previous owner of the home and Ed Rosner was her husband. Jo Faulk (Faulk) was a real estate agent who represented Prudence and Ed Rosner (Rosners) in the sale of the home. Faulk was acting as an agent of Nova Realty, Inc. (Nova). The complaint alleged that Defendants committed fraud and unfair and deceptive trade practices when they sold a home to Plaintiffs in 2003. Plaintiffs sought compensatory and punitive damages from Defendants, jointly and severally.
